properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 2 at 9:31AM MST until February 3 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A winter storm system will bring snow to northeast Wyoming and
western South Dakota tonight through Monday. Snow amounts of
greater than 6 inches are expected across portions of northeast
Wyoming plains, the Bearlodge Mountains, and the northern to
central Black Hills. Lesser amounts are expected along the
northern and eastern foothills. Snow will begin this evening and
continue through Monday morning. Snow will gradually decrease
Monday afternoon, but could linger across portions of the
northeast Wyoming plains into Monday evening.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7
inches.

* WHERE...The Southern Black Hills.

* WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 6 PM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions
could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MST MONDAY
